definition: to vanish/to hide/to cover one's traces

sentences.english: The community's electronic eye has left the thieves nowhere to hide.
sentences.chinese: 社区电子眼，令小偷小摸无处遁形。

sentences.english: God's truth stops the spin of Satan's lies.
sentences.chinese: 上帝的真理能使撒但的谎言无所遁形。

sentences.english: "do not let me fall in love with you, otherwise in the lifetime you will not break away from me"?
sentences.chinese: 不要让我爱上你，否则，你将在我的生命里无所遁形。

sentences.english: But Shang Yang's shortcomings early on in his birth destined in no way Dunxing.
sentences.chinese: 但商鞅的缺陷早就注定于他的出生中无从遁形。

sentences.english: To detect error, expose it to the light of God's truth.
sentences.chinese: 在上帝真光下，谬误无所遁形。

sentences.english: There is thus no room for any weak spot in the singer's voice.
sentences.chinese: 因此在那里，歌手声音中的弱点，也就无处遁形了。

definition: to become visible/to appear/to manifest one's true nature
to show one's true nature (derog.)/to betray oneself
to hinder the eyesight/(fig.) to trick into not noticing/to blindfold
to cover up/to conceal/to go into hiding
to cover/to mask/to cover up or conceal (the truth etc)
to see through/disillusioned with/to reject (the world of mortals)
